abstract: American indexes fell around 5 percent as new data heightened fears that the United States may be headed toward a double-dip recession and that Europe’s debt crisis could widen.
snippet: American indexes fell around 5 percent as new data heightened fears that the United States may be headed toward a double-dip recession and that Europe’s debt crisis could widen.
lead_paragraph: What began as a weak day in the stock markets ended in the worst rout in more than two years, as investors dumped stocks amid anxiety that both Europe and the United States were failing to fix deepening economic problems.

headline.main: Stocks Plunge on Fears of Global Turmoil
headline.print_headline: Stocks in Worst Tumble in 2 Years Amid Global Worry

abstract: The Dow Jones industrial average took a pummeling on Thursday, but another Dow Jones, a resident of Alma, Ark., about 1,400 miles away from New York City, performed better than expected.
snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average took a pummeling on Thursday, but another Dow Jones, a resident of Alma, Ark., about 1,400 miles away from New York City, performed better than expected.
lead_paragraph: The Dow Jones industrial average got pummeled on Thursday, dropping more than 500 points in its worst one-day point loss since late 2008 and sending traders across Wall Street into a panic.

headline.main: This Dow Jones Is Doing Just Fine, Thanks
